meanings.definition: The act of enacting or making into law.
meanings.sent1: The enactments of new rules were celebrated by the community.
meanings.sent2: The city council passed several enactments to improve public safety.
meanings.sent3: The enactments of bedtime by the parents were met with protests from the children.
meanings.sent4: Her enactments of kindness towards others set a positive example for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The enactments of the traffic laws were crucial for maintaining order on the roads.

meanings.definition: A law or statute enacted by a legislative body.
meanings.sent1: The state legislature discussed various enactments related to education funding.
meanings.sent2: The enactments passed by the parliament aimed to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The enactments of the no-talking rule in the library led to some creative silent communication methods.
meanings.sent4: His enactments of fairness and justice were admired by all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The enactments of the trade regulations helped to stabilize the economy.
